page.title: 05LESWALT VILLAGE
page.content: The village is the population for the block and one of several dormitory villages for the Stranraer area. Farming, dairy, beef and sheep, employs few workers, a car sales and service station, the shop and the school seven more. The minister, of a shared parish, and the school staff live outside the area. The villagers are attracted by fine old cottages, excellent council housing and attractively modern bungalows and presently include skilled and unskilled tradesmen and professional people - a doctor, radiographer and nurse, accountant, teacher and policeman, a deep-sea diver and Sealink seamen, a fencer, a dyker and firewood merchant-surely a very cosmopolitan community. July population was 146 adults and 53 children of school age.
